content.value: Today we present the completed RoboWatch in its final form:

items: All systems fully integrated and operational
Comprehensive testing completed with excellent results
Aesthetics and functionality perfectly balanced
Documentation completed for all subsystems
Ready for final symposium!!!

content.value: This marks the successful completion of our RoboWatch project. We're proud of what we've achieved and excited to show it off!
Applied final aesthetic touches to complete the professional look of RoboWatch:

items: Spray painted metal chassis components for an all-black finish
Began taking videos/pictures and crating poster for symposium

content.alt: Spray painting the metal chassis components

content.value: Next steps: Final system check and preparation for project demonstration.
Completed full autonomous system integration and testing:

items: Implemented mapping and localization systems
Conducted extensive autonomous driving tests in various environments
Verified smooth transition of algorithms from V1 to V2 platform
Successfully detected hazards during a prompted floor scanning test
Developed and tested a new web application UI for customer monitoring
Validated ML-based hazard detection (was able to correctly identify loose wire on floor)

content.alt: Web application interface showing hazard detection

content.value: Next steps: Final aesthetic improvements and prepare for demonstration.
Major milestone achieved today with successful integration and driving tests:

items: Completed power distribution system tests
Validated PCB functionality in real-world conditions
Verified firmware operation
Tested motor control and drive systems
Conducted initial mobility assessments with basic maneuvers

content.value: Next steps: Begin integration of autonomous functions and advanced features.
Successfully completed the second version of our custom PCB with significant improvements:

items: Implemented all planned improvements from V1 feedback
Conducted initial electrical tests
Also, prepared code monorepo for experiment replication from V1 robot
Fine-tuned ML model inference experiemnts/testing procedures

content.alt: Completed Version 2 PCB with clean wiring implementation

content.value: Next steps: Integrate PCB with mechanical assembly and conduct initial system tests.
Working on the second version of our PCB to address issues found in V1:

items: Better wiring, and component connection points as opposed to V1
Applied cleaner soldering techniques
Added additional test points for easier debugging
Improved component placement for better thermal management

content.alt: PCB V2 soldering with improved techniques

content.value: Next steps: Complete PCB V2 and prepare for final integration with mechanical systems.
Completed the first version of our custom PCB:

items: Finished soldering all components
Performed initial power-up tests
Conducted continuity and short-circuit checks
Validated key functionality of subsystems
Identified several issues requiring redesign for V2 PCB

content.alt: Completed Version 1 PCB with all components soldered

content.value: Next steps: Redesign and build PCB V2 to address identified issues.
Version 2 mechanical assembly has been completed:

items: Integrated walls, wheels, scissor lift, and all structural elements
Verified all mechanical connections and fasteners
Conducted structural integrity tests
Documented all assembly procedures for future reference
Identified optimal mounting points for electrical components

content.value: Next steps: Integrate electrical systems with the completed mechanical assembly.
Focused today on the crucial scissor lift mechanism:

items: Assembled all scissor lift components
Installed actuator for lift control
Conducted load tests with various weights
Validated extension and retraction operations
Verified connection points to main chassis

content.value: Next steps: Complete final V2 mechanical assembly and prepare for electrical integration.
Major milestone: primary chassis components have been manufactured and assembled:

items: All 3D printed structural components completed
Machined metal components received and inspected
Wall assembly constructed and verified
Initial fit checks conducted for all major components

content.alt: Printed and machined chassis components assembled

content.value: Next steps: Complete scissor lift assembly and wheel hub integration.
Made significant progress on electrical assembly while mechanical manufacturing continues:

items: PCB component soldering in process
Created custom wire harnesses with proper crimping
Applied heat shrinks for wire protection and strain relief
Began preparation for electrical subsystem testing

content.alt: PCB soldering and wire crimping workstation

content.value: Next steps: Complete electrical assembly and prepare for integration with mechanical components.
Full-scale manufacturing for Version 2 has officially begun:

items: 3D printing of complex components initiated
Machining orders submitted for metal components
PCB blanks arrived and ready for component mounting
Manufacturing timeline established with critical path analysis

content.alt: Blank PCB boards ready for component soldering

content.value: Next steps: Begin PCB soldering and continue 3D printing and machining processes.
With software and electrical components validated on V1, we're officially transitioning to Version 2 development:

items: Confirmed all V1 tests met or exceeded performance requirements
Identified key improvements for V2 implementation
Finalized aestheticCAD design for V2 with enhanced features such as a scissor lift
Prepared manufacturing plans for the new design

content.alt: Final CAD model for Version 2 RoboWatch

content.value: Next steps: Begin manufacturing components for Version 2 assembly.
Successfully conducted initial autonomous functionality tests on our V1 robot:

items: Performed basic driving tests in controlled environment
Validated sensor feedback and data processing
Tested basic obstacle avoidance algorithms
Measured performance metrics against design requirements
Identified key improvements for V2 design

content.value: Next steps: Begin transition to V2 robot design based on successful software and electrical validation.
Completed the electrical integration of our V1 robot prototype:

items: Established all electromechanical connections
Just testing correctness of schematic/wiring right now
Performed voltage and continuity tests
Basic load testing (all motors full speed, while moving servos and actuator)

content.alt: Underside of the robot showing complex wiring arrangement

content.value: Next steps: Begin basic autonomous driving tests with the completed V1 robot.
V1 is assembled and ready for testing!

items: Integrated all previously manufactured components
Placed heatset screws, all screws, and all wires
Validated structural integrity of the assembly

content.value: Next steps: Complete wiring and begin electromechanical connections testing.
Continued system integration and testing. Key progress:

items: Completed board holder prints and mounting
Ran extensive ML model inference tests on Jetson
Verified board-to-board communication protocols
Conducted thermal testing under load

content.value: Next steps: Sheet metal manufacturing completion and system assembly.
Major progress on electrical subsystems today:

items: Tested board-to-board communication protocols
Verified DC-DC converter functionality for all voltage levels
Completed camera servo mount assembly
Successfully tested pan-tilt servo system

content.value: Next steps: Complete board mounting system and continue electrical verification.
Major mechanical components taking shape:

items: Completed printing of main chassis top sections
Initiated sheet metal manufacturing for base plate
Test-fitted all printed components
Verified structural integrity of printed parts

content.value: Next steps: Begin electrical component integration testing.
Quick update on 3D printing progress:

items: Completed all motor mounting brackets
Finished LIDAR mounting assembly
Completed camera mounting system

content.value: Next steps: Print main chassis components and begin sheet metal work.
Started the manufacturing phase with 3D printing:

items: Began printing structural components
Optimized print settings for strength
Set up multiple printers for parallel production
First batch includes mounting brackets and supports

content.value: Next steps: Complete motor and sensor mounts.
Made significant progress with sensor integration and board setup:

items: Received and tested LIDAR sensor
Conducted initial sensing experiments
Flashed Jetson Orin NX with development image
Set up Arduino development environment
Created initial sensor testing framework

content.value: Next steps: Begin physical manufacturing of components.
Major milestone reached with hardware preparation:

items: Finalized motor specifications and placed orders
Received Jetson Orin NX and Arduino boards
Completed detailed CAD design
Ordered wheels and mechanical components
Verified all component clearances in assembly

content.value: Next steps: Begin LIDAR integration and board setup.
